snippet.title: Canberra man who sold cocaine to NRL players after Anzac Test fined $5k
snippet.content: A Canberra man has been fined almost $5,000 for supplying cocaine to two high-profile rugby league players outside a nightclub earlier this year. Adrian Mark Crowther, 45, at the Cube nightclub in Canberra's city centre. The players were in town for the Anzac Test at Bruce Stadium against the Kangaroos. Crowther was arrested after police observed him on CCTV preparing a white powder on his phone, before handing it to two men, who rolled up bank notes and consumed the substance. Crowther said he looked up to the players as heroes, and wanted to impress them so they would like him. , but both lost their places in the Kiwi's World Cup Team. In a statement via the Melbourne Storm, Bromwich apologised for making "poor choices" in staying out late and drinking an excessive amount of alcohol, and has been sanctioned by his club. Proctor also released a statement through his club, the Gold Coast Titans, saying the night was a "bit of a blur" and while he could not remember the incident, he did not deny it occurred. He apologised for drinking too much and stood down as co-captain.
